Content:: The tuberculum sellae (or the tubercle of the sella turcica) is a part of the sphenoid bone that is an elevation behind the chiasmatic groove. A variable slight to prominent median elevation forming the posterior boundary of the chiasmatic groove and the anterior boundary of the hypophysial fossa. Tuberculum sellae This article incorporates text in the public domain from page 147 of the 20th edition of Gray's Anatomy (1918)  This human musculoskeletal system article is a stub.
